content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

```
function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame, dt::DateTime)
    # Extract year and month from dt
    yr = Year(dt)
    mth = Month(dt)

    # Create a new column ym by concatenating the year and month together as an integer in format "yyyymm"
    df.ym = (yr*100 + mth)*10000
end
```
This function takes a DataFrame `df` and a DateTime column `dt` as input, extracts the year and month from `dt`, and creates a new column `ym` by concatenating the year and month together as an integer in format "yyyymm". The resulting DataFrame with the new column is returned.
